caption.p: List of diagnostic assays available against equine neuropathogenic viruses enzootic in Europe. PCR = polymerase chain reaction; RT = reverse transcription; VNT = virus neutralization tests; CFT = complement fixation test; DFA = direct fluorescence assay; dRIT = direct rapid immunohistochemistry test; IHC = immunohistochemistry; IFA = indirect fluorescence assay; HIA = hemagglutination inhibition assay; MIA = multiplex immunoassay.

tr.td: Direct virus detection and typing (SNP-PCR) is possible from easily accessible samples (nasal swabs and blood).
Due to highly prevalent and lifelong infection, diagnostic assays should be interpreted with care. Serology will be informative if serial serum samples can be obtained.
Direct virus detection is possible only from the brain of dead animals.
Due to limited antibody response induced after BoDV infection, definitive diagnostic will be made only after direct virus detection from the brain of dead animals.
Indirect assays preferred: ELISA, IFA, HIA, VNT

Rapid serological screening tests (competition ELISA, IFA) are very sensitive but present a low diagnostic specificity; they should be interpreted with care and confronted with results from confirmatory serological assays (VNT, MIA).
Direct virus detection is possible from the brain of dead animals and when positive, indicates recent virus infection.
